title: Number of nursery schools in the United Kingdom 2010 to 2019
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Number of schools, with a total of 9 data points. The chart has 5 significant trends.
The longest trend is slightly negative which exists from 2014/15 to 2010/11.
On the other hand, the next significant trend is moderately neutral which exists from 2018/19 to 2017/18.
On the other hand, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2017/18 to 2016/17.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2016/17 to 2015/16.
But, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2015/16 to 2014/15.
gold: In the academic year 2018/19 there were approximately 3.04 thousand nursery schools in the United Kingdom , around 900 fewer than there were in the 2010/11 academic year . During 2017/18 nursery schools had the worst teacher to pupil ratio in the UK , with around 22 children for every one teacher .
